In this revised list, all entities clearly refer to "Disease". The entity "isolated foveal hypoplasia" is kept, as it is a developmental disorder affecting the fovea, a small area in the center of the retina responsible for sharp, detailed vision. Although "hypoplasia" is a general term for underdevelopment, in this context, it refers to a specific eye condition.

The entity "autosomal dominant keratitis" is also kept, as it is a specific type of keratitis, an inflammation of the cornea. Although "keratitis" can sometimes be a symptom of other diseases, in this context, it is used to describe a distinct eye condition caused by PAX6 mutations.

The other entities, "human" and "congenital", are removed as they do not clearly refer to diseases.
